work.name: Vertical Lift Research Center of Excellence, Georgia Institute of Technology
work.summary: Design and conduct wind tunnel experiments on helicopter ship-deck landing using 6-DOF force transducers, pressure scanners, and PIV systems.

work.name: Aerospace Science and Technology Research Center, NCKU
work.summary: Mechanical design of experimental apparatus for low-speed wind tunnel testing of an aircraft model in a spinning motion using an integrated sting balance.

volunteer.organization: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Design Team, NCKU
volunteer.summary: Weekly tutoring on the topic of aircraft design and UAV systems for undergraduates. Provide advice regarding aircraft design, system integration, and manufacturing.
highlights: Attended the 2020 Taiwan Innovative Green Energy Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Competition

courses: Optimization for the Design of Engineered Systems

awards.title: Taiwan Government Scholarship to Study Abroad (GSSA)
awards.summary: To support outstanding Taiwanese students to pursue advanced studies abroad, selected students were awarded $16,000 NTD per year for up to 2 years.

awards.title: 2nd Place — The Vertical Flight Society 40th Student Design Competition
2022 Best Paper Award — Journal of Aeronautics, Astronautics, and Aviation
awards.awarder: Aeronautical and Astronautical Society of the Republic of China (Taiwan)

awards.title: 3rd Best Paper Award — 2020 AASRC Conference
awards.awarder: Aeronautical and Astronautical Society of the Republic of China (Taiwan)

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
